text: We recently heard that WhatsApp was testing a new interface for its Android app, where the Communities tab was replaced with the "AIs" tab, possibly to provide all AI-powered features in one place. Now, we have learned that WhatsApp is working on a feature that will let users create personalized AI chatbots. This revelation comes from the folks at WABetaInfo, who spotted this feature in version 2.25.1.26 of WhatsApp beta for Android. They also shared a screenshot, included below, which suggests the AI chatbot would be called AI Character. WhatsApp working on personalized AI chatbot creation feature WhatsApp users will be able to create it within the app, and the source claims that WhatsApp also plans to include suggestions to make the chatbot-creating process easier. While creating the chatbot, WhatsApp will ask users to describe what it will do and what its primary objective will be. It's unclear when this feature will be publicly released for everyone worldwide. It's also unavailable for beta users since it's still under development. Source
html:
We recently heard that WhatsApp was testing a new interface for its Android app, where the Communities tab was replaced with the "AIs" tab, possibly to provide all AI-powered features in one place. Now, we have learned that WhatsApp is working on a feature that will let users create personalized AI chatbots.

This revelation comes from the folks at WABetaInfo, who spotted this feature in version 2.25.1.26 of WhatsApp beta for Android. They also shared a screenshot, included below, which suggests the AI chatbot would be called AI Character.


WhatsApp working on personalized AI chatbot creation feature

WhatsApp users will be able to create it within the app, and the source claims that WhatsApp also plans to include suggestions to make the chatbot-creating process easier.

While creating the chatbot, WhatsApp will ask users to describe what it will do and what its primary objective will be.

It's unclear when this feature will be publicly released for everyone worldwide. It's also unavailable for beta users since it's still under development.
